author: Maureen O'Hare
title: New York's MoMA takes top prize at museum 'Oscars'
text:
Story highlights The prestigious Leading Culture Destinations awards are known as the 'Oscars for museums' They honor the world's most visionary art institutions and new culture hotspots New York's MoMA awarded Best Digital Experience and Overall 2015 Winner (CNN) Are the glory days of some of the world's best known museums now ancient history? Seems that way from the results of this year's museum "Oscars."
OK, so the top prize in the prestigious Leading Culture Destinations 2015 awards, announced Friday in London, goes to a classic -- New York's Museum of Modern Art.
Plenty of other usual suspects also made the cut including the Centre Pompidou in Paris and London's Tate Modern.
But other giants of the museum world were elbowed out in favor of new arrivals like the spectacular Oita Prefectural Art Museum in Japan, and architecture supremo Frank Gehry's Fondation Louis Vuitton in Paris.
Who got left out?
Read More Mathaf: Arab Museum of Modern Art, won Best Emerging Culture Destination in the Middle East. That meant no silverware for France's Louvre. It might be the world's most visited art museum, but it didn't even get a look-in.
Global heavyweights including Florence's Galleria degli Uffizi and Madrid's Reina Sofia are similarly out in the cold.
The selections reflect the shift away from the art world's big boys in New York, Paris and London.
After all, 2013's most attended art exhibitions were in Taipei and Rio de Janeiro, not Europe or North America.
The 2015 list gives shout-outs to Mathaf: Arab Museum of Modern Art in Qatar, the Gran Museo del Mundo Maya de Merida in Mexico, and other unexpected destinations that are beginning to present serious competition on the global stage.
Eating, drinking and shopping
La Colombe d'Or's private art collection includes works by Matisse and Cesar. In addition, the cultural institutions leading the way this year aren't just about art appreciation. They're also places to eat, drink, work, shop, socialize and even sleep.
As Andy Warhol said: "All department stores will become museums, and all museums will become department stores."
So alongside exhibitions and programming, museums are also judged on architecture and spatial design, digital experience, shopping, and eating and drinking.
There's even a category for best art experience in a hotel, with this year's winner being France's La Colombe d'Or, a favorite of stars including Francis Ford Coppola and Drew Barrymore.
